job_description: Advanced Manufacturing Research Fellowship Programme in the Basque â New Aquitaine Region (ADAGIO) is a cross-border Programme aimed at enhancing the research and innovation (R&I) capacity and high-quality human resources of the regions of Euskadi (Spain) and New Aquitaine (France) in the selected field of Advanced Manufacturing.ADAGIO is aimed at incorporating postdoctoral talent in the area of Advanced Manufacturing, specifically in the following fields:Advanced Materials & ProcessesIntelligent, Flexible & Efficient Production SystemsDigital & Connected FactoryEnergy EfficiencySustainable Manufacturing.ADAGIO will bring together 15 experienced researchers to develop a 36 month stay through 2 open calls at international level. The fellows may decide whether to carry out a 36 month advanced research project in one of the two hosting institutions, namely the University of the Basque Country (Spain) and the University of Bordeaux (France), or combine it with a more applied research path oriented towards market needs, by doing up to 12 months secondments (with a minimum of 3 months) in one or more of the industrial partner organisations associated with the programme, or in another partner organisation of their own choice.More detailed information can be found on the programme's website: www.ehu.eus/cofund-adagio Eligibility criteriaTo be Experienced Researchers (ER): to hold a doctoral degree (PhD) at the date of the call deadline.To comply with the MSCA mobility rule: not have resided or carried out their main activity (work, studies, etc.) in the country of the recruiting institution (Spain and/or France) for more than 12 months in the 3 years immediately prior to the respective call deadline.Applicants cannot be permanent employees of any of the hosting organisationsApplicants must be able to communicate fluently in English (written and spoken). This last aspect will be checked during the interview process.To submit a complete application, including all required documentation, before the call deadline.All applications must be submitted via the ADAGIO web application currently available on the ADAGIO website.
employer_description: ADAGIO offers 15 post-doctoral fellowships in either of one the 2 hosting institutions: the University of the Basque Country, Spain, and the University of Bordeaux, France.
